item.title: Welcome Danielle Westmark, our IPI Fellow!
item.dc:creator: Ariel Deardorff
item.description:
Danielle is a student in the Inter-professional Informationist (IPI) Program at Simmons University and will be working with Ariel and the Data Science team from Jan-May 2021 as part of her capstone project. Danielle is looking to build on her knowledge of research data management, data science, and reproducibility and ...

Read moreWelcome Danielle Westmark, our IPI Fellow!

item.title: Welcome to the Library Albert Lee!
item.dc:creator: Karla Lindquist
item.description:
On January 4 2021, Albert Lee joined the Library’s Data Science Initiative team as a Data Science Instructional Designer and Analyst. Please join the DSI team in welcoming Albert to UCSF and to the Library! Albert will be working with the DSI team two days per week. He will be ...

item.title: Building Data Skills in California Libraries
item.dc:creator: Ariel Deardorff
item.description:
Ariel shares about a project she worked on this year with the nonprofit organization The Carpentries From Jan to Sept of this year 20% of my time was dedicated to a grant-funded project with The Carpentries, a global non-profit dedicated to teaching data and software skills to researchers and librarians. ...

Read moreBuilding Data Skills in California Libraries

item.dc:creator: Joanna Kang
item.description:
LinkedIn Learning: Now Available for UCSF LinkedIn Learning (previously Lynda.com) is now available to UCSF through a campus license. LinkedIn Learning has thousands of video courses covering technical, business, software, and creative topics. Courses include: Zoom Engagement for Meetings, Working From Home Strategies, Using Python for Automation, EndNote Essentials, and ...

item.title: Education and Research Team Support Updates!
item.dc:creator: Micquel Little
item.description:
The Education and Research Team has updated our approach to ready reference and reference manager tool support. Our Ready Reference project set out to update documentation and support resources to inform and empower front line staff to answer basic ready reference questions received across the various mediums available: email/tickets, walk-ups, ...

Read moreEducation and Research Team Support Updates!

item.title: New UC Chat Reference Service!
item.dc:creator: Peggy Tahir
item.description:
The UC Libraries have switched to a new chat reference service. We stopped using OCLC’s QuestionPoint system and have just switched over to using SpringShare’s LibAnswers service. You will recognize SpringShare since we already use it for our LibGuides and for scheduling classes and events in LibCal. Library patrons will ...

Read moreNew UC Chat Reference Service!

item.title: Enabling Zoom Integration in the UCSF Library Slack
item.dc:creator: Richard Trott
item.description:
I created a two-minute screencast to show how to enable Zoom integration in the UCSF Library Slack, for those wishing to do it. We’re stuck doing this on a user-by-user basis for now, so you need to do a one-time authorization to use the integration. The screencast shows how to ...

Read moreEnabling Zoom Integration in the UCSF Library Slack

item.title: Video Conferencing Options in Slack
item.dc:creator: Richard Trott
item.description:
I received a request for Zoom integration in Slack. I thought it might be worthwhile to put the answer here. It would be great to install Zoom for Slack in a way that it is available to all users in the Library Slack. Unfortunately, this requires someone with Zoom administrative ...

item.title: Please welcome Katie Keyser!
item.dc:creator: Susan Boone
item.description:
Katie’s joining the Collection Management unit as our Electronic Resources Specialist. She comes to us from UCB where she managed electronic books, databases, and journals. She will be our primary point person for analyzing and resolving access problems for electronic resources. She’s an avid quilter—her current project is a baby ...

item.title: Introducing the 2020 Library Open Research Challenge!
item.dc:creator: Ariel Deardorff
item.description:
Are you planning on publishing an article, giving a talk, or designing a class this year? Why not participate in the 2020 library open research challenge and publish in an open access journal, deposit your presentation in eScholarship, or make your class materials freely available on the CLE! The goal ...
